title: Eh Moo Nah
author: Eh Moo Nah
content: If I am going to Create a Post and then someone gave merit and then I deleted the Post because I already have the answer that I am Looking for.. will the Merit be removed as well or will I still have it Regardless if the Post is Removed? Thanks for the Answer Awesome Human being!!!!

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: It won't be removed. It will remain as it is regardless of the post gets deleted or not.

comments.author: paid2
comments.body: Yes, as Little Mouse said, you won't lose your merit or smerit.This topic could be useful if you are not aware of his existence :FAQ: Everything you need to know about forum 'activity, account ranks and meritQuoteCan I be demerited or lose merit?No, not currently. Even if your post is removed the merit will still stay.

comments.author: MusaPk
comments.body: If you are starting a new thread then you can't delete the stating post, you can edit it. Subsequent posts can be deleted after 24 hours or on some forums immediately.

comments.author: acroman08
comments.body: I just want to add to what Little Mouse has said, is that the only thing that will change when a merited post/thread is deleted, is the link to the deleted post or thread. if you check your merit summary, the link to the merited post or thread will be shown as "ignored/deleted"(or something similar to that)

comments.author: aysg76
comments.body: Whenever someone gives merit to any user he has to determine the number of smerits he is willing to hand out and at the bottom you will find the line which says : This cannot be undone  which means it can't be reversed.So if you delete a post or it gets deleted by the moderator also the merits you get on that one remains exactly the same so you don't need to worry about it but make good post so you don't have to delete them.Quote from: MusaPk on May 18, 2023, 05:12:52 PMIf you are starting a new thread then you can't delete the stating post, you can edit it. Subsequent posts can be deleted after 24 hours or on some forums immediately. The service board also has this restriction that you can't delete a post before 24 hours so you simply edit it and can delete later on but on general boards you can delete your posts without this restriction.

comments.author: Zanab247
comments.body: The merit will remain because you have be merited before the post was deleted, but don't forget that people will not merit a Post that is not a quality Post or relate to the topic that involve the Post at the moment. Don't come with a mind set that people will merit a Post that will be deleted at the end of the day, so try your possible best to avoid such attitude by involving in quality Post through out your journey.

comments.author: Aanuoluwatofunmi
comments.body: Quote from: Eh Moo Nah on May 18, 2023, 04:10:24 PMIf I am going to Create a Post and then someone gave merit and then I deleted the Post because I already have the answer that I am Looking forWhy do you have to delete the post in the first instance, dont you know that anyone can also come across such and read to learn from it, also what makes you think you will earn a merit on the post you made, even afterall it may end up being deleted by you or a moderator.Quote from: Eh Moo Nah on May 18, 2023, 04:10:24 PMwill the Merit be removed as well or will I still have it Regardless if the Post is Removed? The merit remains, but getting merit o this forum is not determined by you, rather it is by the person reading what you're saying and feels it worth deserving a merit, if that post is being deleted and was the only one that helps you maintain the activity required for the rank you are, then you will be demoted except you have enough posts to cover up for your activity for that rank while your merit still remains provided that you get any.

However, you can not delete your opening post in a thread. Only admin and moderator can trash a whole thread.

Thanks for the Answer Awesome Human being!!!!Once a post is merited and a profile is merited, that merit will not be removed in any way. even if you delete the post yourself or a moderator deletes your post, the merit will remain on your profile. but if someone abuse the merit then in that case he can get a natural or red tag and there will be no other problem. but an admin has the power to edit someone's account and has the ability to remove merit from a profile. but such a thing has never been seen done by the admin, nor have I seen it, and I do not think he will do it
